body:
That looks like a regression - thanks for reporting.

It seems like the depth 1 listing code in dropbox is broken:

```
$ rclone ls --max-depth 1 dropbox:Photos
2017/02/22 09:28:41 Failed to ls: path "/Photos/XXXX" is not under root "/Photos/"
```

I'll post a beta for you to try when I've figured out what is going on.

I've fixed this in the beta below

    http://beta.rclone.org/v1.35-131-g12aa03f/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Let me know if it works for you - re-open the ticket if it doesn't

Thanks

The sync itself has been fixed, but there is some weird issue with Capitalisation of the folders now.

    rclone lsd --max-depth=2 secret:Dropbox/:

          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:09        -1 Work
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:00        -1 Important
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:59        -1 backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:02        -1 photos
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:04        -1 work
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:52        -1 important
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:51        -1 BackUps
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:37        -1 Photos
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:38        -1 temp files
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:13        -1 work/yr2
          -1 2017-02-22 19:10:23        -1 work/yr3
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:57        -1 work/yr1
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:57        -1 important/uni
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:29        -1 photos/4K
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:48        -1 photos/Portrait
          -1 2017-02-22 19:10:23        -1 photos/Backgrounds
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:06        -1 backups/file backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:06        -1 backups/config backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:51        -1 backups/Android Backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:40        -1 backups/File Backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:04        -1 BackUps/Android Backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:09        -1 Work/yr3
          -1 2017-02-22 19:07:40        -1 temp files/Receipts
          -1 2017-02-22 19:08:00        -1 Important/Personal

I'm not really sure what is causing this issue though.
I think its something to do with having a mix of files and folders in a single directory.
I think that is probably caused by #1103 which I haven't fixed yet.

I'm not sure, it wasn't this way with 1.35.
I purged the directory and resynced with 1.35 again and am now seeing:

          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:19        -1 Important
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:59        -1 Temp Files
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:00        -1 BackUps
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:58        -1 Photos
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:09        -1 Work
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:54        -1 Work/yr2
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:55        -1 Work/yr1
          -1 2017-02-22 19:28:33        -1 Work/yr3
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:01        -1 BackUps/Config Backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:08        -1 BackUps/File Backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:05        -1 BackUps/Android Backups
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:24        -1 Photos/Portrait
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:24        -1 Photos/Spanned
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:22        -1 Photos/4K
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:06        -1 Photos/Backgrounds
          -1 2017-02-22 19:27:12        -1 Temp Files/Receipts
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:56        -1 Important/Personal
          -1 2017-02-22 19:26:57        -1 Important/Uni

Which is how it should be.

This looks like the sync itself is causing strangely named folders, rather than the listing command.
In the log output in the latest beta, I can see


    2017/02/22 19:31:18 INFO  : backups/Android Backups/Reddit Sync/file.1: Copied (new)
    ...
    2017/02/22 19:31:18 INFO  : BackUps/Android Backups/Action Launcher Pro/file.2: Copied (new)

Which looks like its physically writing new folders of backups and Backups, rather than it being a listing error.

The reason why it is different between v1.35 and the latest beta is that rclone uses a different method of listing the files.

I'm going to re-open this issue and think some more on how to fix it.

Ah that would make sense! 

I only mentioned since it means that files synced in 1.35 are the new beta are incompatible.

Running `rclone sync` with the latest beta on a backup made with 1.35 does a full recopy of all files (well almost all), which whilst it isn't an issue for me with 4GB of files, could be an issue for other people expecting to only move a file or two.

I think I have fixed this here.  Would you mind trying the sync again and see if it is fixed for you?

http://beta.rclone.org/v1.35-138-g527099a/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks

Nick

Perfect! That has fixed it for me!

Cheers for the quick fix, and amazing project!

issue.title: lsl with max-depth for Dropbox remote doesn't list files

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I use rclone 1.35 on Windows. When trying to execute rclone with `lsl` command on non-root folder together with `--max-depth 1` I get strange behavior.

For some folders it works fine, `rclone lsl --max-depth 1 MyDropbox:data/folderA` correctly shows:

       352545 2014-12-21 06:10:53.000000000 a.pdf
       139217 2014-12-20 09:11:34.000000000 b.pdf

But for other it shows error, `rclone lsl --max-depth 1 MyDropbox:data/folderB`

    2017/02/04 22:56:48 path "/data/folderB/some-file.pdf" is not under root "/data/folderB/"

Dropbox web interface shows that `some-file.pdf` file is really inside data/folderB folder.
Adding -v shows following:

    2017/02/04 22:59:49 rclone: Version "v1.35" starting with parameters ["C:\\bin\\rclone.EXE" "lsl" "--max-depth" "1" "-v" "MyDropbox:data/folderB"]
    2017/02/04 22:59:50 Dropbox root 'data/folderB': Modify window not supported                                                                                           
    2017/02/04 22:59:50 path "/data/folderB/some-file.pdf" is not under root "/data/folderB/"

Doing `rclone lsl MyDropbox:data/folderB` correctly displays all files in folderB (and its subfolders).
Doing `rclone lsl --max-depth 2 MyDropbox:` shows error message:

    2017/02/04 23:03:14 level value not supported

What is wrong here?
